title: The Acropolis (mountain)
text:
The Acropolis is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in the <a href="Central%20Highlands%20%28Tasmania%29">Central Highlands</a> region of <a href="Tasmania">Tasmania</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>. Situated in the <a href="Cradle%20Mountain-Lake%20St%20Clair%20National%20Park">Cradle Mountain-Lake St Clair National Park</a>, the mountain is part of the <a href="Du%20Cane%20Range">Du Cane Range</a>.
With an elevation of <a href="Australian%20Height%20Datum">above sea level</a>, it is within the top twenty-five <a href="List%20of%20highest%20mountains%20of%20Tasmania">highest mountains in Tasmania</a>. It is a major feature of the national park, and is a popular venue with bushwalkers and <a href="Mountaineering">mountain climbers</a>.
The word "<a href="acropolis">acropolis</a>" means a high city or <a href="citadel">citadel</a>.
